TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit StopRoutingHandler extends System.Object implements class System.Web.Routing.IRouteHandler

Docs.summary: Provides a way to specify that ASP.NET routing should not handle requests for a URL pattern.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The StopRoutingHandler class enables you to specify that ASP.NET routing should not handle certain URL requests. You prevent routing from handling certain requests by defining a route and specifying that the StopRoutingHandler class should be used to handle that route's pattern. When a request is handled by a StopRoutingHandler object, the StopRoutingHandler object blocks any additional processing of the request as a route. Instead, the request is processed as an ASP.NET page, Web service, or other ASP.NET endpoint.
## Examples The following example shows how to prevent routing from handling requests for .axd requests.
[!code-vb[System.Web.Routing.StopRoutingHandler#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.routing.sto_1.asax)] [!code-cs[System.Web.Routing.StopRoutingHandler#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.routing.sto_1.asax)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.Routing.StopRoutingHandler> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.Routing.IRouteHandler> interface.
